intro: Myrsine collina, commonly known as the coastal myrsine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptic in shape, and have a glossy, dark green appearance. The flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and are usually white or pale pink, with four or five petals.
